snippet: An international panel said there was no evidence to support the government’s conclusion that the college students who disappeared last fall were executed by a drug gang.
abstract: Panel of experts appointed by Inter-American Commission for Human Rights, part of Organization of American States, finds no evidence that 43 Mexican students who disappeared in 2014 were killed by drug gang; says federal police and soldiers chose not to intervene as students were attacked by municipal police; notes that most should still be considered missing as only one body has been identified.
lead_paragraph: An international panel said there was no evidence to support the government’s conclusion that the college students who disappeared last fall were executed by a drug gang.

headline.main: Experts Reject Official Account of How 43 Mexican Students Were Killed
headline.print_headline: Experts Reject Official Account of How 43 Mexican Students Were Killed

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
